window.ga=window.ga||function(){(ga.q=ga.q||[]).push(arguments)};ga.l=+new Date;

var host = window.location.host;
var domain = 'auto';
switch(host) {
  case "www.authorea.com" :
    ga('create', 'UA-37313163-2', domain);
    break;
  case "authorea.com":
    ga('create', 'UA-37313163-3', domain);
    break;
  case "prereview.org":
    ga('create', 'UA-107005711-1', domain);
    break;
  default: // unknown domain, assume it's the main one as a fallback
    ga('create', 'UA-37313163-2', domain);
}


ga('send', 'pageview');


</script>

     <script>
$("#export-article-form").on('shown',function(){
  $('#input-export-style-search').focus()
})

$('#input-export-style-search').on('change', function(e) {
  var selected_style_name = $(this).val();
  var selected_option = $(".export-style-dropdown option").filter(function() {
    return ($(this).text() == selected_style_name);
  });
  selected_option.prop('selected', true).change();
});

$('.export-style-submit-preview').click(function(e) {
  e.preventDefault();

  old_style = ArticlesHelper.style_selected;
  if (old_style) {
    $(old_style).removeClass("btn-primary");
    $(old_style).closest(".export-subcategory").find(".dropdown-toggle").removeClass("btn-primary")
  }
  $(this).addClass("btn-primary")
  $(this).closest(".export-subcategory").find(".dropdown-toggle").addClass("btn-primary")
  ArticlesHelper.style_selected = $(this)
  $(".default-export-style-name").text($(this).find(".export-style-name").text())
  $(this).blur();
});

var current_style_preview_src = $('.img-export-style-preview').attr("src");
var current_style_name = $('.export-style-name').text().replace(/^.+\:/,'');

$('.export-style-dropdown').on('mouseenter','option',function(e) {
  $('.export-style-name').text($(this).text().replace(/^.+\:/,''));
  $('.img-export-style-preview').attr("src","/assets/thumbnails/"+$(this).val()+".png");
})

$('.export-style-dropdown').change(function() {
  current_style_name =  $(this).find("option:selected").text().replace(/^.+\:/,'');
  current_style_preview_src = "/assets/thumbnails/"+$(this).val()+".png";
  $('.export-style-name').text(current_style_name);
  $('.img-export-style-preview').attr("src",current_style_preview_src);
  $("#export_style_symbol").val($(this).val());
}).blur(function() {
  $('.export-style-name').text(current_style_name);
  $('.img-export-style-preview').attr("src",current_style_preview_src);
});

$('#input-citation-style-search').on('change', function(e) {
  citation_style_name = $(this).val();
  citation_style_symbol = export_citation_style_names[citation_style_name];
  $("#citation_style_symbol").val(citation_style_symbol);
});

$('.export-format-button').click(function(e) {
  e.preventDefault();
  ArticlesHelper.waiting_for_export = true;
  var export_format = $(this).val();
  es = $("form.form-export-style");
  es.find('.export-format').val(export_format);
  es.bind("ajax:success", function(data, contents, xhr) {
      if (!contents) {
        $("#export-article-form").modal('hide');
        $("#export-article-errors-collapsed").css("display","none");
        $("#export-article-progressbar").modal('show');
      }
    })
    .bind("ajax:error", function(xhr, status, error) {
      console.error("Export encountered server error: ", error);
    });
  es.submit();
});
</script> 
     <div class="modal hide fade" id="export-article-progressbar" tabindex="-1" role="dialog" aria-labelledby="exportProgressBarLabel" aria-hidden="true">

       <button type="button" class="close" data-dismiss="modal" aria-hidden="true">×</button>

        <h5 class="panel-title"> 
         <center> 
          <a class="errors-see-details" style="font-weight: 400;" href="javascript:void(0);" id="export-article-errors-toggle-details"> View compilation logs </a> 
         </center> </h5> 
        <div id="export-article-errors-collapsed" style="display: none;"> 
         <div id="export-error-details"></div>

       <script type="text/javascript">
$('#export-article-errors-toggle-details').click(function (e) {
  $("#export-article-errors-collapsed").toggle();
  // Only do the setup once:
  if (! $.export_errors) { return; }
  var errors = $.export_errors;
  $.export_errors = false;

  var details_node = $("#export-error-details");
  details_node.html(""); // Reset inner HTML, to enable reuse

  for (var error_type in errors) {
    if (! errors.hasOwnProperty(error_type)) { continue; }
    error_list = errors[error_type];
    details_node.append("<h5>"+error_type+"</h5>");
    var ul = document.createElement("ul");
    for (var i = 0; i < error_list.length; i++) {
      error_instance_lines = error_list[i];
      if (error_type == 'pdflatex') {
        first_line = error_instance_lines.shift()
        var simple_line = first_line.replace(/^[!]?\s*LaTeX Error:\s*/,'');
        if ((simple_line == first_line) && (!simple_line.match(/^[!]?\s*Undefined/))) { continue; }
        second_line = error_instance_lines.shift()
        var li = document.createElement("li");
        $(li).append('<strong>'+simple_line+'</strong><br>'+
          '<span class="btn-danger">'+second_line+'</span><br>');
      }
      for (var j=0; j<error_instance_lines.length; j++) {
        var detail_line = error_instance_lines[j];
        if (detail_line && detail_line.match(/^l\./)) {
          $(li).append(+'<br>');
        }
      }
      $(ul).append(li);
    }
    details_node.append(ul);
  }
  details_node.append('<a download="true" href="/users/1713/articles/7010/download_log">Download Full Log</a>');
});

</script> 
      </div> 
      <div class="modal-footer"> 
       <center>
        Please contact 
        <a href="mailto:help@authorea.com">help@authorea.com</a> for support.
       </center> 
      </div> 
     </div> 
     <script type="text/javascript">
var export_progressbar_interval;

$("#export-article-progressbar").on('show.bs.modal', function () {
  $("#export-errors-article-form").hide();
  $("#export-article-progressbar-fatal").hide();
  $("#export-article-progressbar-pdf-ready").hide();
  $("#export-article-progressbar-noncollab-pdf-ready").hide();
  $("#export-article-progressbar-word-ready").hide();
  $("#export-article-progressbar-noncollab-word-ready").hide();
  var stages = [
  "Tip: Upload a CSV or Excel file to your document to easily add tables.",
  "Invite three colleagues to Authorea for a free private document.",
  "You can add a dataset or source code to any figure in your documents",
  "Authorea has integrations with Jupyter Notebooks, d3.js, and more.",
  "Work in a team? Create a group, invite your colleagues, and privately share documents with them.",
  "Your document is almost ready. Depending on size, this could take a few seconds or even a few minutes."];

  var export_timeout_in_sec = 600000; // 10 minutes
  var total_time = 5000; // Exporting in ~5 seconds
  var interval_delta = 100; // Increment bar every 100 m
  var export_timeout_in_steps = export_timeout_in_sec / interval_delta;
  var change_every = 3000; // Change text every 3 seconds

  var modal = $(this);
  var increment_window = change_every / interval_delta;
  var steps_total = total_time / interval_delta;
  var step_width = modal.width() / steps_total; // Sync the bar with the stages
  var width_limit = modal.width() - (steps_total / 10)*step_width; // Hold incomplete at 95%
  var steps = 0;

  $("#export-article-progressbar-message")
    .css('margin-top', '')
  $("#export-article-logo").css('opacity', 1)
  $("#export-article-progressbar-loading").css('opacity', 1)

  if (export_progressbar_interval) { 
    clearInterval(export_progressbar_interval);
  }
  export_progressbar_interval = setInterval(function() {
    if (steps % increment_window === 0) {
      if (stages.length > 0) {
        $("#export-article-progressbar-message").text(stages.shift());
      }
      if (steps >= export_timeout_in_steps) {
        // Took too long, timeout
        clearInterval(export_progressbar_interval);
        var logo = $('#export-article-logo');
        logo.css('opacity', 0);
        $('#export-article-progressbar-loading').css('opacity', 0);
        $("#export-article-progressbar-message").text("Timeout : Server did not respond after 10 minutes. Please retry or contact support.").css('margin-top', - logo.outerHeight() + 'px');
        $('.btn-download-export').hide();
        $('#export-article-progressbar-fatal').show();
      }
    }
    steps++;
  }, interval_delta);
});

$("#export-article-progressbar").on('hide.bs.modal', function () {
  if (export_progressbar_interval) { clearInterval(export_progressbar_interval); }
});

</script> 
    </div> 
   </div>

       <li> <a id="btn-follow-article" data-toggle="tooltip" data-placement="bottom" title="Follow" rel="nofollow" class="article-view__social-button"> <i class="icon-star-empty"></i> </a> </li> 
       <div class="hidden"> 
        <form class="inline-form" id="form-follow-article" data-type="json" action="/follow/follow_article" accept-charset="UTF-8" data-remote="true" method="post">
         <input name="utf8" type="hidden" value="?"> 
         <input type="hidden" name="article_id" id="article_id" value="7010"> 
         <input type="submit" name="commit" value="Follow" class="btn btn-gray"> 
        </form> 
        <form class="inline-form" id="form-unfollow-article" data-type="json" action="/follow/unfollow_article" accept-charset="UTF-8" data-remote="true" method="post">
         <input name="utf8" type="hidden" value="?"> 
         <input type="hidden" name="article_id" id="article_id" value="7010"> 
         <input type="submit" name="commit" value="Follow" class="btn btn-gray"> 
        </form>
       </div> 
       <script>
  $("#form-unfollow-article").bind('ajax:success', function(evt, data, status, xhr) {
    $("#btn-follow-article").removeClass("following");
      $("#btn-follow-article").html('<i class="icon-star-empty"></i>');
  });

  $("#form-follow-article").bind('ajax:success', function(evt, data, status, xhr) {
      $("#btn-follow-article").html('<i class="icon-star"></i>');
      $("#btn-follow-article").addClass("following");
  });

  jQuery(document).ready(function(){
    if (!$("#article-data").data()["currentUser"]) {
      $("#btn-follow-article").attr("data-original-title", "Sign-up to use this feature");
      $("#btn-follow-article").tooltip();
    }

    if ($("#article-data").data()["isFollowing"]) {
        $("#btn-follow-article").html('<i class="icon-star"></i>');
      $("#btn-follow-article").addClass("following");
    } else{
        $("#btn-follow-article").html('<i class="icon-star-empty"></i>');
      $("#btn-follow-article").removeClass("following");
    }

    $('#btn-follow-article').click(function(e) {
      e.preventDefault();
      if ($('#btn-follow-article').hasClass("following")) {
        console.info("unfollowing");
        $("#form-unfollow-article").submit();
      } else {
        console.info("following");
        $("#form-follow-article").submit();
      }
    });
  });
</script>

       <a class="article-view__social-button" data-toggle="tooltip" data-placement="bottom" title="Tweet" onclick="share_modal('twitter', '#{twitter_url(@article)}')" href="javascript:void(0);" id="btn-share-article-on-twitter"><i class="icon-twitter"></i></a>

       <div class="panel leftPanel"> 
        <h1 id="article-paragraph-title__dot__md" class="article-paragraph au-article-title"> A Simple Custom Similarity-Based Recommender System </h1> 
        <div id="paragraph-toolbar-info-title__dot__md" class="paragraph-toolbar-info" style="display:none" data-paragraph-id="title__dot__md" data-filename="title.md" data-has-insert-button="false" data-has-checkout-button="true" data-has-edit-button="true" data-has-ipython-notebook="false" data-is-image="false" data-url="/users/1713/articles/7010/master/file/title.md">
         this is for holding javascript data
        </div> 
        <div class="article-paragraph-editor" id="article-paragraph-editor-title__dot__md" style="display:none" data-paragraph-id="title__dot__md" data-filename="title.md" data-name-without-ext="title" data-page-path="null" data-formats="[{&quot;name&quot;:&quot;Bibtex&quot;,&quot;id&quot;:&quot;bibtex&quot;,&quot;selected&quot;:false},{&quot;name&quot;:&quot;HTML&quot;,&quot;id&quot;:&quot;html&quot;,&quot;selected&quot;:false},{&quot;name&quot;:&quot;Latex&quot;,&quot;id&quot;:&quot;latex&quot;,&quot;selected&quot;:false},{&quot;name&quot;:&quot;Markdown&quot;,&quot;id&quot;:&quot;markdown&quot;,&quot;selected&quot;:true}]" data-paragraph-format="markdown" data-raw="A Simple Custom Similarity-Based Recommender System" data-can-rename-file="false" data-editor-base-id="gollum-editor-title__dot__md" data-paragraph-post-address="/users/1713/articles/7010/master/file/title.md/_edit">

     <div id="wiki-paragraph-container"> 
      <div id="wiki-paragraph-abstract__dot__md" class="wiki-paragraph"> 
       <div class="leftPanel panel"> 
        <div id="article-paragraph-abstract__dot__md" class="article-paragraph"> 
         <span class="abstract"><span class="abstract-section">Abstract</span>The demand of recommender systems has been greatly increased for the last few times after the trending of personalization within various kind of systems. This leads to the better achievement of the best recommendation or more precise result could be for both service providers or users. So there is actually a need for users to create their own custom recommendation in a small scale. That would help them get personal recommendations as simple and fast as possible, but without having to involved in a complex system. For the better and more precise result, the system would be enhanced with semantic similarity method. One of the best method to achieve this is by using a framwork, such as Crab Python framework for building recommender engines or systems. As the outcome, regular users could provide themselves with simple custom recommendations by their own configuration. The best case would present users the most related recommendations with high accuracy of preferences.</span> 
        </div> 
        <div id="paragraph-toolbar-info-abstract__dot__md" class="paragraph-toolbar-info" style="display:none" data-paragraph-id="abstract__dot__md" data-filename="abstract.md" data-has-insert-button="true" data-has-checkout-button="true" data-has-edit-button="true" data-has-ipython-notebook="false" data-is-image="false" data-url="/users/1713/articles/7010/master/file/abstract.md">
         this is for holding javascript data
        </div> 
        <div id="article-paragraph-editor-abstract__dot__md" class="article-paragraph-editor" style="display:none" data-paragraph-id="abstract__dot__md" data-filename="abstract.md" data-name-without-ext="abstract" data-page-path="null" data-formats="[{&quot;name&quot;:&quot;Bibtex&quot;,&quot;id&quot;:&quot;bibtex&quot;,&quot;selected&quot;:false},{&quot;name&quot;:&quot;HTML&quot;,&quot;id&quot;:&quot;html&quot;,&quot;selected&quot;:false},{&quot;name&quot;:&quot;Latex&quot;,&quot;id&quot;:&quot;latex&quot;,&quot;selected&quot;:false},{&quot;name&quot;:&quot;Markdown&quot;,&quot;id&quot;:&quot;markdown&quot;,&quot;selected&quot;:true}]" data-paragraph-format="markdown" data-raw="The demand of recommender systems has been greatly increased for the last few times after the trending of personalization within various kind of systems. This leads to the better achievement of the best recommendation or more precise result could be for both service providers or users. So there is actually a need for users to create their own custom recommendation in a small scale. That would help them get personal recommendations as simple and fast as possible, but without having to involved in a complex system. For the better and more precise result, the system would be enhanced with semantic similarity method. One of the best method to achieve this is by using a framwork, such as Crab Python framework for building recommender engines or systems. As the outcome, regular users could provide themselves with simple custom recommendations by their own configuration. The best
case would present users the most related recommendations with high accuracy of preferences." data-render-report="null" data-can-rename-file="true" data-editor-base-id="gollum-editor-abstract__dot__md" data-paragraph-post-address="/users/1713/articles/7010/master/file/abstract.md/_edit">

      <!-- wiki-paragraph --> 
      <div id="wiki-paragraph-introduction__dot__md" class="wiki-paragraph"> 
       <div class="leftPanel panel"> 
        <div id="article-paragraph-introduction__dot__md" class="article-paragraph"> 
         <h1 data-sourcepos="1:1-1:14" class="ltx_title_section">Introduction</h1> 
         <p data-sourcepos="3:1-13:67">Recommender systems have always been used for almost anything that related within user and usage relation of subjects, entities, and ratings.<br> Most of them are created specifically for particular subjects.<br> It can be used primarily for research, user assistant, personal needs, or even just for fun.<br> This kind of dynamic feedback based on actual collected data is helpful to find the most related or appropriate information that would be presented.<br> Nevertheless, it's still only made by researchers, producers, or creators.<br> If regular users want to exactly configure their needs and have a small scale recommendation for personal use, they need to use a simpler method to achieve the result that recommender system could produce.<br> So without having to complicate themselves with various algorithms and a lot of information that they need to know before.<br> In this case, using a framework is recommended to build that kind of recommender system.<br> Still, people will know the underlying principles behind the system but while understanding and building in the highest system layer.<br> Moreover, the system would be enhanced with a semantic similarity or semantic relatedness method.<br> So the better and more precise the recommendation results would be.</p> 
         <h2 data-sourcepos="15:1-15:38" class="ltx_title_subsection">Similarity-Based Recommender System</h2> 
         <p data-sourcepos="17:1-25:142">Recommender system or recommendation engine are so called to basically give people or users more offers or options about something that closely related with the item or content they're liking, watching, or using.<br> The item could be a foods, books, movies, songs, games, places, and so on even people.<br> Most of them are created by the developers, specifically or focused only just to recommend chosen subjects.<br> People mostly have various tastes, but those can be calculated as patterns or converted into models.<br> What will be done in this work is taking those patterns or models, then generate the recommendations with similarities in mind.<br> Because of that, this will also considered as a semantic similarity system since the relation between items are all logically related and meaningful.<br> Actually the real considered semantic recommender is any system that bases its performance on a knowledge base <cite class="ltx_cite raw v1"><a class="au-cite-link" href="#Peis2008">(Peis 2008)</a></cite>.<br> Also lately, the basic good recommendation is one that increases the usefulnes of your product in the long run, even it's hard to measure directly <cite class="ltx_cite raw v1"><a class="au-cite-link" href="#Levy2013">(Levy 2013)</a></cite>.<br> Or better yet, that could gives or predicts a similar, better, or new desirable things that might haven't know or discovered yet by the users.</p> 
         <p data-sourcepos="27:1-31:135">This work in progress will focus on the item-based recommenders approach, figuring out what items are similar with the one that have already been liked.<br> <strong>Item-based or similarity-based recommender system</strong> is included in a bigger scale called <strong>collaborative filtering</strong> and moreover, <strong>machine learning</strong>.<br> Generally it produces recommendations based on the information or knowledge that users have about their relationships to one or some items.<br> So there is is no requirement for prior knowledge of the properties or attributes of the items themselves.<br> The items could be so various like some of the mentioned before and nothing about their attributes need to enter into any of the input.</p> 
         <h2 data-sourcepos="33:1-33:37" class="ltx_title_subsection">Crab Recommender Systems Framework</h2> 
         <p data-sourcepos="35:1-35:317">Crab, formerly known as aureplacedverbatimaa , is a Python framework for building recommender systems and engines integrated with the world of scientific Python packages (<a href="http://muricoca.github.io/crab">http://muricoca.github.io/crab</a>) <cite class="ltx_cite raw v1"><a class="au-cite-link" href="#Crab2012">(Caraciolo 2012)</a></cite>. It's released as an open source project and commercially usable with BSD license (3 clause).</p> 
         <p data-sourcepos="37:1-37:33">It has useful segmented features:</p> 
         <ul data-sourcepos="39:1-42:0"> 
          <li data-sourcepos="39:1-39:76"><strong>Recommender Algorithms</strong>: User-Based Filtering and Item-Based Filtering.</li> 
          <li data-sourcepos="40:1-40:67"><strong>Work in progress</strong>: Slope One, SVD, Evaluation of Recommenders.</li> 
          <li data-sourcepos="41:1-42:0"><strong>Planned</strong>: Sparse Matrices, REST APIs.</li> 
         </ul> 
         <p data-sourcepos="43:1-43:95">Which will be used in this work is item-based filtering for defining semantic similarity items.</p> 
        </div> 
        <div id="paragraph-toolbar-info-introduction__dot__md" class="paragraph-toolbar-info" style="display:none" data-paragraph-id="introduction__dot__md" data-filename="introduction.md" data-has-insert-button="true" data-has-checkout-button="true" data-has-edit-button="true" data-has-ipython-notebook="false" data-is-image="false" data-url="/users/1713/articles/7010/master/file/introduction.md">
         this is for holding javascript data
        </div> 
        <div id="article-paragraph-editor-introduction__dot__md" class="article-paragraph-editor" style="display:none" data-paragraph-id="introduction__dot__md" data-filename="introduction.md" data-name-without-ext="introduction" data-page-path="null" data-formats="[{&quot;name&quot;:&quot;Bibtex&quot;,&quot;id&quot;:&quot;bibtex&quot;,&quot;selected&quot;:false},{&quot;name&quot;:&quot;HTML&quot;,&quot;id&quot;:&quot;html&quot;,&quot;selected&quot;:false},{&quot;name&quot;:&quot;Latex&quot;,&quot;id&quot;:&quot;latex&quot;,&quot;selected&quot;:false},{&quot;name&quot;:&quot;Markdown&quot;,&quot;id&quot;:&quot;markdown&quot;,&quot;selected&quot;:true}]" data-paragraph-format="markdown" data-raw="# Introduction

Recommender systems have always been used for almost anything that related within user and usage relation of subjects, entities, and ratings.
Most of them are created specifically for particular subjects.
It can be used primarily for research, user assistant, personal needs, or even just for fun.
This kind of dynamic feedback based on actual collected data is helpful to find the most related or appropriate information that would be presented.
Nevertheless, it&amp;#39;s still only made by researchers, producers, or creators.
If regular users want to exactly configure their needs and have a small scale recommendation for personal use, they need to use a simpler method to achieve the result that recommender system could produce.
So without having to complicate themselves with various algorithms and a lot of information that they need to know before. 
In this case, using a framework is recommended to build that kind of recommender system.
Still, people will know the underlying principles behind the system but while understanding and building in the highest system layer.
Moreover, the system would be enhanced with a semantic similarity or semantic relatedness method.
So the better and more precise the recommendation results would be.

## Similarity-Based Recommender System

Recommender system or recommendation engine are so called to basically give people or users more offers or options about something that closely related with the item or content they&amp;#39;re liking, watching, or using.
The item could be a foods, books, movies, songs, games, places, and so on even people.
Most of them are created by the developers, specifically or focused only just to recommend chosen subjects.
People mostly have various tastes, but those can be calculated as patterns or converted into models.
What will be done in this work is taking those patterns or models, then generate the recommendations with similarities in mind.
Because of that, this will also considered as a semantic similarity system since the relation between items are all logically related and meaningful.
Actually the real considered semantic recommender is any system that bases its performance on a knowledge base \cite{Peis2008}.
Also lately, the basic good recommendation is one that increases the usefulnes of your product in the long run, even it&amp;#39;s hard to measure directly \cite{Levy2013}.
Or better yet, that could gives or predicts a similar, better, or new desirable things that might haven&amp;#39;t know or discovered yet by the users.

This work in progress will focus on the item-based recommenders approach, figuring out what items are similar with the one that have already been liked.
**Item-based or similarity-based recommender system** is included in a bigger scale called **collaborative filtering** and moreover, **machine learning**.
Generally it produces recommendations based on the information or knowledge that users have about their relationships to one or some items.
So there is is no requirement for prior knowledge of the properties or attributes of the items themselves.
The items could be so various like some of the mentioned before and nothing about their attributes need to enter into any of the input.

## Crab Recommender Systems Framework

Crab, formerly known as `scikits.recommender`, is a Python framework for building recommender systems and engines integrated with the world of scientific Python packages (&amp;lt;http://muricoca.github.io/crab&amp;gt;) \cite{Crab2012}. It&amp;#39;s released as an open source project and commercially usable with BSD license (3 clause).

It has useful segmented features:

- **Recommender Algorithms**: User-Based Filtering and Item-Based Filtering.
- **Work in progress**: Slope One, SVD, Evaluation of Recommenders.
- **Planned**: Sparse Matrices, REST APIs.

Which will be used in this work is item-based filtering for defining semantic similarity items." data-render-report="null" data-can-rename-file="true" data-editor-base-id="gollum-editor-introduction__dot__md" data-paragraph-post-address="/users/1713/articles/7010/master/file/introduction.md/_edit">
         this is a placeholder for an editor
        </div> 
       </div>

      <div id="wiki-paragraph-components__dot__md" class="wiki-paragraph"> 
       <div class="leftPanel panel"> 
        <div id="article-paragraph-components__dot__md" class="article-paragraph"> 
         <h1 data-sourcepos="1:1-1:12" class="ltx_title_section">Components</h1> 
         <p data-sourcepos="3:1-3:80">There are few main components that need to be installed and it can be done from:</p> 
         <ul data-sourcepos="5:1-7:0"> 
          <li data-sourcepos="5:1-5:39">Operating system package distribution</li> 
          <li data-sourcepos="6:1-7:0">Official release archive or repository</li> 
         </ul> 
         <p data-sourcepos="8:1-8:115">It is more recommended to install from source by having these dependencies first (with their common package names):</p> 
         <ul data-sourcepos="10:1-19:0"> 
          <li data-sourcepos="10:1-10:41">Python development tools (<code>python-dev</code>)</li> 
          <li data-sourcepos="11:1-11:44">Numpy (<code>python-numpy</code>, <code>python-numpy-dev</code>)</li> 
          <li data-sourcepos="12:1-12:34">setuptools (<code>python-setuptools</code>)</li> 
          <li data-sourcepos="13:1-13:24">SciPy (<code>python-scipy</code>)</li> 
          <li data-sourcepos="14:1-14:35">Atlas Build Tool (<code>libatlas-dev</code>)</li> 
          <li data-sourcepos="15:1-15:26">GNU C++ Compiler (<code>g++</code>)</li> 
          <li data-sourcepos="16:1-16:53">scikit-learn for Machine Learning (<code>scikits.learn</code>)</li> 
          <li data-sourcepos="17:1-17:34">matplotlib (<code>python-matplotlib</code>)</li> 
          <li data-sourcepos="18:1-19:0">nose Unit Testing Framework (<code>nose</code>)</li> 
         </ul> 
         <p data-sourcepos="20:1-20:238">Then finally the Crab framework (<code>crab</code>). All can be done by using os-based package managers; <code>apt-get</code>, <code>pip</code> or <code>easy_install</code>. Or also get the repository (<a href="https://github.com/muricoca/crab">https://github.com/muricoca/crab</a>) then install with <code>python setup.py install</code>.</p> 
        </div> 
        <div id="paragraph-toolbar-info-components__dot__md" class="paragraph-toolbar-info" style="display:none" data-paragraph-id="components__dot__md" data-filename="components.md" data-has-insert-button="true" data-has-checkout-button="true" data-has-edit-button="true" data-has-ipython-notebook="false" data-is-image="false" data-url="/users/1713/articles/7010/master/file/components.md">
         this is for holding javascript data
        </div> 
        <div id="article-paragraph-editor-components__dot__md" class="article-paragraph-editor" style="display:none" data-paragraph-id="components__dot__md" data-filename="components.md" data-name-without-ext="components" data-page-path="null" data-formats="[{&quot;name&quot;:&quot;Bibtex&quot;,&quot;id&quot;:&quot;bibtex&quot;,&quot;selected&quot;:false},{&quot;name&quot;:&quot;HTML&quot;,&quot;id&quot;:&quot;html&quot;,&quot;selected&quot;:false},{&quot;name&quot;:&quot;Latex&quot;,&quot;id&quot;:&quot;latex&quot;,&quot;selected&quot;:false},{&quot;name&quot;:&quot;Markdown&quot;,&quot;id&quot;:&quot;markdown&quot;,&quot;selected&quot;:true}]" data-paragraph-format="markdown" data-raw="# Components

There are few main components that need to be installed and it can be done from:

- Operating system package distribution
- Official release archive or repository

It is more recommended to install from source by having these dependencies first (with their common package names):

- Python development tools (`python-dev`)
- Numpy (`python-numpy`, `python-numpy-dev`)
- setuptools (`python-setuptools`)
- SciPy (`python-scipy`)
- Atlas Build Tool (`libatlas-dev`)
- GNU C++ Compiler (`g++`)
- scikit-learn for Machine Learning (`scikits.learn`)
- matplotlib (`python-matplotlib`)
- nose Unit Testing Framework (`nose`)

Then finally the Crab framework (`crab`). All can be done by using os-based package managers; `apt-get`, `pip` or `easy_install`. Or also get the repository (&amp;lt;https://github.com/muricoca/crab&amp;gt;) then install with `python setup.py install`.
" data-render-report="null" data-can-rename-file="true" data-editor-base-id="gollum-editor-components__dot__md" data-paragraph-post-address="/users/1713/articles/7010/master/file/components.md/_edit">
         this is a placeholder for an editor
        </div> 
       </div>

      <div id="wiki-paragraph-layers__dot__md" class="wiki-paragraph"> 
       <div class="leftPanel panel"> 
        <div id="article-paragraph-layers__dot__md" class="article-paragraph"> 
         <h1 data-sourcepos="1:1-1:8" class="ltx_title_section">Layers</h1> 
         <p data-sourcepos="3:1-3:147">To make it simple, it is better to classify all of the main experiment components or tools with their associated resources into categorized layers.</p> 
         <h2 data-sourcepos="5:1-5:14" class="ltx_title_subsection">System Base</h2> 
         <p data-sourcepos="7:1-7:24">Python, Numpy, and SciPy</p> 
         <h2 data-sourcepos="9:1-9:22" class="ltx_title_subsection">Engine or Framework</h2> 
         <p data-sourcepos="11:1-11:4">Crab</p> 
         <h2 data-sourcepos="13:1-13:15" class="ltx_title_subsection">Dataset Load</h2> 
         <p data-sourcepos="15:1-15:263">Various datasets can be created from scratch or are available from GroupLens; such as MovieLens for movie ratings, HetRec (for Delicious Bookmarks, Last.fm listening records, MovieLens with IMDb/Rotten Tomatoes ratings), Book-Crossing (BX), and Jester jokes list.</p> 
         <h2 data-sourcepos="17:1-17:17" class="ltx_title_subsection">Approach Model</h2> 
         <p data-sourcepos="19:1-19:51">Item-based or similarity-based recommender system.</p> 
         <h2 data-sourcepos="21:1-21:24" class="ltx_title_subsection">Recommendation Result</h2> 
         <p data-sourcepos="23:1-23:34">Array of possible recommendations.</p> 
        </div> 
        <div id="paragraph-toolbar-info-layers__dot__md" class="paragraph-toolbar-info" style="display:none" data-paragraph-id="layers__dot__md" data-filename="layers.md" data-has-insert-button="true" data-has-checkout-button="true" data-has-edit-button="true" data-has-ipython-notebook="false" data-is-image="false" data-url="/users/1713/articles/7010/master/file/layers.md">
         this is for holding javascript data
        </div> 
        <div id="article-paragraph-editor-layers__dot__md" class="article-paragraph-editor" style="display:none" data-paragraph-id="layers__dot__md" data-filename="layers.md" data-name-without-ext="layers" data-page-path="null" data-formats="[{&quot;name&quot;:&quot;Bibtex&quot;,&quot;id&quot;:&quot;bibtex&quot;,&quot;selected&quot;:false},{&quot;name&quot;:&quot;HTML&quot;,&quot;id&quot;:&quot;html&quot;,&quot;selected&quot;:false},{&quot;name&quot;:&quot;Latex&quot;,&quot;id&quot;:&quot;latex&quot;,&quot;selected&quot;:false},{&quot;name&quot;:&quot;Markdown&quot;,&quot;id&quot;:&quot;markdown&quot;,&quot;selected&quot;:true}]" data-paragraph-format="markdown" data-raw="# Layers

To make it simple, it is better to classify all of the main experiment components or tools with their associated resources into categorized layers.

## System Base

Python, Numpy, and SciPy

## Engine or Framework

Crab

## Dataset Load

Various datasets can be created from scratch or are available from GroupLens; such as MovieLens for movie ratings, HetRec (for Delicious Bookmarks, Last.fm listening records, MovieLens with IMDb/Rotten Tomatoes ratings), Book-Crossing (BX), and Jester jokes list.

## Approach Model

Item-based or similarity-based recommender system. 

## Recommendation Result

Array of possible recommendations." data-render-report="null" data-can-rename-file="true" data-editor-base-id="gollum-editor-layers__dot__md" data-paragraph-post-address="/users/1713/articles/7010/master/file/layers.md/_edit">
         this is a placeholder for an editor
        </div> 
       </div>
